page.title: 12Local History South Yorks.
page.content: Of the three{Stately Homes}in this area two of them are still lived in by the families that built them.They are Brodsworth Hall and Hooton Hall. The houses are built in very different styles.The family who built Brodsworth Hall came over from France during the French Revolution and they were {Huguenots.}Lots of the furnishing and ornaments are French style.There are also some paintings that the family brought over from France.There was a skirmish at Hooton during the time of the{Civil War}according to local tradition at a place known to the locals only as Oliver Hill.It is not shown on the Ordnance Survey map.In World War 2 Lord Halifax was refused entry into his home at Hickleton Hall by a sentry after returning late from a very important cabinet meeting in London.The soldier was commended.
